Question: What is the name of your AI Workstation project?
Guidance: Provide internal project reference name

Question: Who is the primary stakeholder for this AI infrastructure project?
Guidance: Name, role, and decision-making authority
Notes: Main point of contact and decision authority

Question: What AI/ML challenges are you trying to solve with local GPU infrastructure?
Guidance: Common challenges: High cloud GPU costs, Data transfer bottlenecks, Data sovereignty concerns, Slow model iteration, Limited flexibility
Notes: Primary business driver for on-premises AI investment

Question: What is your current AI/ML infrastructure setup?
Guidance: Describe cloud instances, on-prem servers, GPU resources, and pain points

Question: How many data scientists and ML engineers need dedicated workstations?
Guidance: Typical ranges: 1-5, 6-10, 11-25, 25+
Notes: Determines hardware quantity and deployment scale

Question: What types of AI/ML workloads will you run?
Guidance: Common types: LLM training, Computer vision, NLP, Reinforcement learning, Data preprocessing, Model inference
Notes: Workload classification drives GPU and storage sizing

Question: What are your primary goals for deploying AI workstations?
Guidance: Common goals: Reduce cloud costs, Improve data security, Accelerate model training, Enable larger models, Support collaborative research

Question: How will you measure AI workstation deployment success?
Guidance: Define KPIs: training time reduction, cost savings vs cloud, model accuracy improvements, developer productivity

Question: What is your expected timeline for AI workstation deployment?
Guidance: Typical ranges: 0-4 weeks, 1-3 months, 3-6 months, 6+ months
Notes: Project timeline expectations and procurement constraints

Question: What is your approved budget range for AI infrastructure?
Guidance: Common ranges: $50K-$250K, $250K-$500K, $500K-$1M, $1M+. Include both CapEx and OpEx

Question: What is your long-term vision for AI/ML infrastructure?
Guidance: Consider expansion to more users, GPU clusters, distributed training, MLOps platform

Question: How do you expect AI team size and compute needs to change over 3 years?
Guidance: Provide current team size and projected annual growth rate

Question: What ML frameworks and libraries do you currently use?
Guidance: Common frameworks: PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX, scikit-learn, Hugging Face Transformers, XGBoost

Question: What specific ML framework versions are required?
Guidance: List versions if critical for model compatibility

Question: What GPU memory capacity is required for your largest models?
Guidance: Options: 24GB (RTX A5000), 48GB (RTX A6000), 80GB (A100 PCIe). Consider model size + batch size + gradient accumulation
Notes: GPU selection (A5000 vs A6000 vs A100)

Question: Do you need multi-GPU support for distributed training?
Guidance: Options: Single GPU adequate, 2-4 GPUs per workstation, GPU cluster needed

Question: What is your typical model training duration with current infrastructure?
Guidance: Specify hours or days; helps validate GPU specs adequate

Question: What is your target/acceptable model training time?
Guidance: Target duration affects GPU quantity and performance tier

Question: What is your typical training dataset size per project?
Guidance: Ranges: < 1TB, 1-5TB, 5-10TB, 10TB+

Question: Where are training datasets currently stored?
Guidance: Sources: AWS S3, Azure Blob, Google Cloud Storage, On-prem NAS, Local drives, SFTP server

Question: Do you need shared dataset storage for team collaboration?
Guidance: Options: Yes (team dataset repository), No (individual local storage only)
Notes: PowerScale NAS for centralized dataset access

Question: What dataset loading speed is required?
Guidance: Typical: 1-2GB/s adequate, 3-5GB/s better, 7GB/s+ optimal. Fast NVMe reduces I/O bottlenecks
Notes: Storage tier selection (SATA SSD vs NVMe)

Question: How much system RAM do your workloads typically require?
Guidance: Common: 128GB adequate, 256GB better, 512GB for large-scale preprocessing

Question: What CPU-intensive preprocessing or data tasks do you perform?
Guidance: Examples: Data augmentation, Feature engineering, Video decoding, Multi-threaded preprocessing
Notes: CPU core count and performance requirements

Question: What operating system do you prefer for AI workstations?
Guidance: Options: Ubuntu 22.04 LTS, RHEL 8/9, Windows 11 Pro with WSL2, Dual-boot

Question: What CUDA toolkit version do you require?
Guidance: Common: CUDA 11.8 (legacy), CUDA 12.x (current). Must match framework compatibility

Question: What development environments and tools do you use?
Guidance: Common: Jupyter Lab, VS Code, PyCharm, TensorBoard, MLflow, Weights & Biases

Question: Do you use Docker or container-based workflows?
Guidance: Options: Yes (Docker/Podman required), No (native Python environments)
Notes: Container runtime and NVIDIA Container Toolkit setup

Question: What version control and collaboration tools do you use?
Guidance: Common: GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, DVC (Data Version Control)

Question: Do users need remote access to AI workstations?
Guidance: Options: Local only, SSH/terminal access, Remote desktop (VNC/RDP), JupyterHub web interface
Notes: Remote access architecture and VPN requirements

Question: Do you need distributed training across multiple machines?
Guidance: Options: Single-node only, Multi-node with Horovod/DeepSpeed/PyTorch DDP
Notes: Network fabric and MPI configuration for clustering

Question: Do you need centralized model storage and versioning?
Guidance: Options: Local only, Shared NFS model registry, MLflow/DVC tracking server

Question: What is the highest data classification level in your AI datasets?
Guidance: Levels: Public, Internal, Confidential, Restricted, PII/PHI
Notes: Determines encryption and access control requirements

Question: What sensitive data types are present in your training datasets?
Guidance: Sensitive types: PII, PHI, Financial data, Proprietary algorithms, Customer data, Research IP

Question: What compliance standards must the AI infrastructure meet?
Guidance: Common standards: SOC 2, ISO 27001, HIPAA, FedRAMP, GDPR, ITAR

Question: Do you have data residency or sovereignty requirements?
Guidance: On-premises data requirements affect cloud vs local storage decisions

Question: What encryption requirements apply to datasets and models?
Guidance: Requirements: Encryption at rest (LUKS/BitLocker), Encryption in transit (TLS), Key management

Question: What authentication and authorization requirements apply?
Guidance: Options: Local user accounts, Active Directory/LDAP, SSO (SAML/OIDC), MFA required, Certificate-based

Question: What network segmentation or isolation is required?
Guidance: Options: Open network, VLAN isolation, Air-gapped environment, Firewall rules

Question: What audit and logging requirements do you have?
Guidance: Requirements: User access logs, Training job logs, Data access audit trail, GPU utilization tracking
Notes: Audit trail and compliance reporting needs

Question: What security patching and vulnerability management processes apply?
Guidance: Specify update frequency and approval procedures

Question: Do ML training scripts require security review or approval?
Guidance: Security scanning for data exfiltration or credential exposure
Notes: Code security and peer review processes

Question: Where will the AI workstations be physically located?
Guidance: Options: Data center, Office space, Lab environment, User desks

Question: What power and cooling capacity is available?
Guidance: Precision 7960 + RTX A6000: ~500W per workstation. Ensure adequate circuit capacity and HVAC

Question: What network connectivity is available at workstation location?
Guidance: Required: 10GbE for shared storage access. 1GbE minimum, 25GbE/40GbE optimal

Question: Do you prefer rack-mount or tower form factor?
Guidance: Precision 7960 available as tower or rackmount. Tower for desks, rack for data center

Question: What uptime requirements do you have for AI workstations?
Guidance: Common: Best-effort (no SLA), Business hours (8x5), High availability (99%+)

Question: Do you need backup of training checkpoints and models?
Guidance: Options: No backup (re-train acceptable), Local snapshots, Shared storage backup, Cloud sync

Question: What support coverage do you require from Dell?
Guidance: Options: Next business day, 4-hour response (ProSupport Plus), 24x7 mission critical

Question: What monitoring and alerting is required for GPU infrastructure?
Guidance: Requirements: GPU utilization metrics / Temperature monitoring / Job queue visibility / Resource allocation tracking

Question: How will you provision and configure new workstations?
Guidance: Options: Manual setup, Ansible/Puppet automation, PXE boot with Kickstart, Golden image cloning

Question: What maintenance windows are acceptable for updates and patches?
Guidance: Specify days/times for system maintenance and reboots

Question: Who will be the technical lead for this AI workstation project?
Guidance: Name, role, contact information

Question: What internal resources are available for deployment and configuration?
Guidance: List team members, roles, and time commitment (hours per week)
Notes: Resource planning and project timeline feasibility

Question: What is your team's experience with Linux administration?
Guidance: Experience levels: No experience, Basic, Intermediate, Advanced, Expert
Notes: Training needs assessment for Ubuntu/RHEL administration

Question: What is your team's experience with NVIDIA GPU drivers and CUDA?
Guidance: Experience levels: No experience, Basic, Intermediate (troubleshoot drivers), Advanced (optimize kernels)
Notes: CUDA configuration and troubleshooting support needs

Question: What is your preferred deployment approach?
Guidance: Options: Pilot (1-2 workstations first), Phased (rollout by team), Full deployment (all at once)

Question: How will you migrate existing datasets to new infrastructure?
Guidance: Consider data transfer time, bandwidth, and validation procedures
Notes: Data migration planning and timeline impact

Question: What training will be needed for users and administrators?
Guidance: Types: Admin training (Linux/CUDA), User training (tools/workflows), Best practices (GPU optimization)

Question: What existing ML workflows or scripts need to be validated?
Guidance: List critical training pipelines and dependencies to test

Question: Do you need on-site installation or remote configuration is acceptable?
Guidance: Dell ProDeploy available for rack installation and basic setup
Notes: Dell ProDeploy services and on-site support needs

Question: What criteria must be met before workstations are production-ready?
Guidance: Examples: Benchmark performance validated, User training complete, Monitoring operational, First model trained successfully

Question: What are your concerns about migrating from cloud to on-premises?
Guidance: Consider: upfront cost, hardware lifecycle, scalability, maintenance burden
Notes: Primary implementation concerns and risk factors

Question: How do you plan to handle GPU hardware refresh cycles?
Guidance: GPUs evolve rapidly (18-24 month cycles). Consider 3-year depreciation and upgrade path
Notes: Hardware lifecycle and technology refresh planning

Question: What happens if you need more compute capacity than initially deployed?
Guidance: Options: Add more workstations, Cloud burst for peak demand, Wait for next budget cycle
Notes: Scalability constraints and hybrid cloud strategy

Question: What is your tolerance for workstation hardware failures?
Guidance: Failed workstation affects one user. Shared storage failure affects team. Assess risk appetite
Notes: Failure mode analysis and mitigation strategies

Question: What concerns do you have about Dell hardware dependency?
Guidance: Hardware-agnostic software (PyTorch/TensorFlow portable). CUDA ties to NVIDIA GPUs

Question: How will power outages affect training jobs in progress?
Guidance: Consider UPS for graceful shutdown, checkpoint frequency for recovery
Notes: Power protection and job recovery procedures

Question: What is your biggest concern about managing on-prem AI infrastructure?
Guidance: Common: Linux administration, GPU driver troubleshooting, Storage management, Network configuration
Notes: Skill development and external support requirements

Question: What constraints must the solution work within?
Guidance: Consider: CapEx limits, OpEx annual budget, Approval processes, Procurement timelines
Notes: Solution design boundaries and financial constraints

Question: What is your current monthly cloud GPU spend?
Guidance: Calculate: instance type × hours/day × days/month × $/hour. Example: p3.2xlarge (V100) × 8hrs × 22 days × $3.06 = $540/month
Notes: ROI baseline for cost comparison analysis

Question: What cloud GPU instance types are you currently using?
Guidance: Common AWS: p3 (V100), p4d (A100), g5 (A10G). Azure: NC-series, ND-series. GCP: A2 instances
Notes: Performance and cost comparison with on-prem

Question: What data transfer costs do you incur moving datasets to/from cloud?
Guidance: AWS S3 egress: $0.09/GB. Large datasets (multi-TB) incur significant costs
Notes: Hidden cloud costs that on-prem eliminates

Question: What ROI timeline and payback period are you targeting?
Guidance: On-prem AI workstations typically achieve ROI in 3-6 months vs cloud GPU costs

Question: Do you have preferences or constraints around CapEx vs OpEx spending?
Guidance: Consider: Dell Financial Services leasing (converts CapEx to OpEx), budget approval processes
